1.brief: to be high actively, to rise or raise (in various applications, literally or figuratively)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
(by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
properly, to dangle, i.e. to let down abucket (for drawing out water); figuratively, to deliver
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
probably to brighten up, i.e. (figuratively) be (causatively, make) blithe or gleesome

2.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God

gods in the ordinary sense; but specifically used (in the plural thus, especially with the article) of the supreme God; occasionally applied by way of deference to magistrates; and sometimes as a superlative
properly, to be free; but used only causatively and reflexively, to halloo (for help, i.e. freedom from some trouble)
near, with or among; often in general, to
properly, to mend (by stitching), i.e. (figuratively) to cure

3.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to ascend, intransitively (be high) or actively (mount); used in a great variety of senses, primary and secondary, literal and figurative
properly, a part of; hence (prepositionally), from or out of in many senses
Hades or the world of the dead (as if a subterranean retreat), including its accessories and inmates
properly, a breathing creature, i.e. animal of (abstractly) vitality; used very widely in a literal, accommodated or figurative sense (bodily or mental)
to live, whether literally or figuratively; causatively, to revive

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
a pit hole (especially one used as a cistern or a prison)

4.brief: play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
a memento, abstractly recollection (rarely if ever); by implication, commemoration
a sacred place or thing; rarely abstract, sanctity

5.brief: (by implication) very widely used as a relative conjunction or adverb (as below); often largely modified by other particles annexed
a wink (of the eyes), i.e. a very short space of time
properly, the nose or nostril; hence, the face, and occasionally a person; also (from the rapid breathing in passion) ire
alive; hence, raw (flesh); fresh (plant, water, year), strong; also (as noun, especially in the feminine singular and masculine plural) life (or living thing), whether literally or figuratively
to stop (usually over night); by implication, to stay permanently; hence (in a bad sense) to be obstinate (especially in words, to complain)
a weeping; by analogy, a dripping
properly, dawn (as the break of day); generally, morning
properly, a creaking (or shrill sound), i.e. shout (of joy or grief)

6.brief: properly, a failure; by implication nothing; usually (adverb) not at all; also lest
to waver; by implication, to slip, shake, fall
properly, concealed, i.e. the vanishing point; generally, time out of mind (past or future), i.e. (practically) eternity; frequentatively, adverbial (especially with prepositional prefix) always

7.brief: Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to stand, in various relations (literal and figurative, intransitive and transitive)
strength in various applications (force, security, majesty, praise)
to hide (by covering), literally or figuratively
the face (as the part that turns); used in a great variety of applications (literally and figuratively); also (with prepositional prefix) as a preposition (before, etc.)
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to tremble inwardly (or palpitate), i.e. (figuratively) be (causative, make) (suddenly) alarmed or agitated; by implication to hasten anxiously

8.brief: near, with or among; often in general, to
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to call out to (i.e. properly, address by name, but used in a wide variety of applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
the Lord (used as a proper name of God only)
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)

9.brief: properly, interrogative what? (including how? why? when?); but also exclamation, what! (including how!), or indefinitely what (including whatever, and even relatively, that which); often used with prefixes in various adverbial or conjunctive senses
blood (as that which when shed causes death) of man or an animal; by analogy, the juice of the grape; figuratively (especially in the plural) bloodshed (i.e. drops of blood)

to descend (literally, to go downwards; or conventionally to a lower region, as the shore, a boundary, the enemy, etc.; or figuratively, to fall); causatively, to bring down (in all the above applications)
near, with or among; often in general, to
a pit (especially as a trap); figuratively, destruction
physically, to throw (a stone, an arrow) at or away; especially to revere or worship (with extended hands); intensively, to bemoan (by wringing the hands)
dust (as powdered or gray); hence, clay, earth, mud

properly, to front, i.e. stand boldly out opposite; by implication (causatively), to manifest; figuratively, to announce (always by word of mouth to one present); specifically, to expose, predict, explain, praise

10.brief: to hear intelligently (often with implication of attention, obedience, etc.; causatively, to tell, etc.)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
properly, to bend or stoop in kindness to an inferior; to favor, bestow; causatively to implore (i.e. move to favor by petition)
Jehovah, Jewish national name of God
to exist, i.e. be or become, come to pass (always emphatic, and not a mere copula or auxiliary)
to surround, i.e. protect or aid

11.brief: to turn about or over; by implication, to change, overturn, return, pervert
to open wide (literally or figuratively); specifically, to loosen, begin, plough, carve
properly, a mesh (as allowing a liquid to run through), i.e. coarse loose cloth or sacking (used in mourning and for bagging); hence, a bag (for grain, etc.)

play upon it; to make music, accompanied by the voice; hence to celebrate in song and music
properly, weight, but only figuratively in a good sense, splendor or copiousness
not (the simple or abs. negation); by implication, no; often used with other particles
to be dumb; by implication, to be astonished, to stop; also to perish
